page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: The 12 square kilometre area we have studied extends to the South-West of our small village of{Bulphan. { }Most of the area is drained{fenland, generally very flat but with a gentle rising slope at the western side, towards the villages of{North Ockendon and{South Ockendon. Scattered about the northern part of the area are a number of small{farms, which provide{employment}for some of the villagers. However,{Bulphan}is mainly a{dormitory village}for people who work in{London}or in the nearby{ {newtown}of{Basildon. There are many{public footpaths} across the area, giving good access to the fields and small tributaries of the{River Mardyke,}making it an ideal place for{Nature}and{Wildlife}study.
